message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you a unique opportunity to purchase a high-end item. I believe you'll find it valuable and worth the investment. I'm willing to let it go for $25000. What do you think?
I'm very interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $18000. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?
I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. I can do $20000, and that's as low as I can go. What do you think?
I'm still very interested in the product, but I need to stay within my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $18500?

I'm starting to think you're really serious about this product, Bob. I'm willing to make a slight concession, but I need to make sure I'm getting a fair price. I can do $19500, and that's as low as I can go. What do you think?
I've been very patient, but I really need to stay within my budget. I'm willing to pay $18000 for the product. This is my final offer.

Bob, I appreciate your persistence, but I'm starting to think you're not willing to meet me at a price that's reasonable for the product's value. I'm willing to make one more concession, but that's it. I can do $19000, and that's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to consider other options.
I've made it clear that I'm willing to pay $18000, and that's my final offer. I'm not willing to go any higher. I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I understand you're firm on $18000, but I'm not willing to give up any more. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our last two offers. I can do $18800, and that's as low as I can go. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to explore other options.
